title: "Right now, however, jungle experience falls off a little too hard".
body:
Yeah, for a lot of Junglers (Say, Irelia, Akali, Shen and Talon) wandering back into the jungle is far less inviting mid-game than taking someone's lane which develops all kinds of problems.

I think boosting the Gold values of jungle minions would benefit a lot of these (and other) Champions who aren't getting enough out of the jungle mid-late game and are scaling off hard because of it in competitive matches however on the flip side I think other junglers (say Gragas) might get a bit too much out of this EXP boost.

I think other Junglers (Rek'Sai, Warwick) are far to envious of farming in the jungle and wont gain much out of an EXP boost and I also think a lot of the Smite bonuses aren't worth waiting for on Junglers like say Irelia, Akali, Shen and Talon; and junglers like Warwick, Mundo, Sejuani and Fiddle gain heaps out of the jungles smite bonuses.

I do like the new jungle bonuses and find it pretty balanced I just think rare Junglers are missing out when it comes to the smite bonuses as well as the new Jungle items and traditional Junglers are dragged back into the Jungler to scrape up gold and aren't getting quite enough, even if they are fed or are having to spend too long in the Jungle and some of the more prominent (mainly the sustained Junglers) are to blame for the current Gold values being what they are.

replies.body: Can you think of a new jungle bonus that would help the majority of your listed champions? (I don't play jungle enough let alone niche jungles, hence why I'm asking for your suggestion). I think the wolves smite bonus could do with changing; I feel it has the smallest impact on the game.
Smite enemy wolves and it has a lot more impact (bot/top side vision on enemy jungler = harder ganks)

Good point.

I'd still be curious to hear opinions are different possible smite bonuses. 
I just don't know enough to understand why these champions (Irelia, Akali, Shen and Talon) aren't getting useful buffs from the smite bonuses where others are. If that could be explained, then I'd be happy to try and discuss remedies.

Irelia smites: Gromp, Raptor, Wolves

Reasoning: Irelia lacks AoE clear, which gromp gives, Raptor buff is basically usable by every jungler, and wolves cause wards are amazing.

Akali smites: Golems, Raptor, Wolves

Reasoning: Akali has the AoE clear, so what would help her clear more, is being able to minimize the damage from the bigger creep

Shen smites: Gromp, Raptor, Wolves

Talon Smites: Golems, Raptor, Wolves.

Sadly as it stands, you only want to smite one of Gromp/Golems based on your champion, then raptor and wolves, but honestly this isn't a bad thing, most of these champs also don't want trail blazers (honestly chilling smite is the better choice on all of these.) meaning you don't actually want to burn your smite on the camps.

This was actually helpful, I'll try and keep this in mind - perhaps I need more foresight and the bonuses aren't the problem.

"Can you think of a new jungle bonus that would help the majority of your listed champions? (I don't play jungle enough let alone niche jungles, hence why I'm asking for your suggestion). I think the wolves smite bonus could do with changing; I feel it has the smallest impact on the game."

The only jungle bonus I can think of would be movespeed (Riftscuttler covered that to some degree) but a movespeed bonus wouldn't benefit tanks so much as it'd wear off because of their slow clears, maybe one that didn't scale hugely into lategame and Junglers like Rek'Sai etc would be Capped with it because they'd hit the MS cap sooner and Champions like Shen, Akali, Talon and Irelia would benefit greatly from it, although shen probably the least of the 4 but his Kit would make up for it.

Early game yes, but smiting to wolves mid- or late-game essentially gives vision of blue-side jungle which is invaluable once laning is finished. It is a free, moving ward and TBH I use it far more than krug stun.

Once again fair point. 
I can definitely see how it would be more useful late game.
The gromp smite is reaaaly strong late game.

* Assuming your a tank/have a Cassiopeia on your team
* Assuming enemys are stupid enough to attack you while having this buff
* Assuming it lasted more then 90 seconds

Plus for really strong 10% scaling off bonus health is pretty poor, unless you go full health tank, in which case the ADC blows on you and you die. (assuming 4000 bonus health, this is a 410 Magic damage over 3 seconds, which yes is strong until you consider the fact that ADC's have lifesteal and it doesn't stack triggers which turns it into a slightly stronger sunfire cape.)
